part.line: What happened? Why has everyone stopped?
part.narration: Shimizu points to the financial report.Shimizu points at the money indicator on the heads-up display; the indicator flashes.
part.line: None shall receive a line of code from a starved programmer.
Such is the rule of X-Tremes.
Sooner or later, we'll have families to provide for!
How are we to bear fruit when employers provide no seed?

part.narration: Yuki gazes at Ganpu, mouth open slight. Yet— there is no time for this face to gape. There is no time in the lives of the men of Japan! Money! Money! Focus!
part.line: Nozomi money didn't come from Sonic Adventure Portable, Nozomi money came from something else.
Tell me what is.
Behold, Sega's long-beating pacemaker:
part.narration: Nozomi runs to an easily overlooked table. She waves her hands around something. It's a tarp.The table is easily overlooked because it was never there before. Nozomi urges the player to get close to the tarp. Yuki looks at the camera and shrugs.Nozomi launches the tarp. Under it is a laptop computer with its file browser highlighting an item; a game.
part.line: The Clan!
The online game? I thought that one was your ruin.
They early deemed it so because we were not as smart as Jacques.
They dreamed not that the future of the industry would rest on residuals.
Had he not made this game, we would ruined long before La Sortie.

Then let's begin.
Click on the application to continue.

part.line: It rebooted?
Yeah.
part.narration: The computer's web-camera turns on. The monitor quickly flashes Yuki's face.
part.line: Stand still.

part.narration: The video image disappears. A chromeless terminal appears.
part.line: Face successfully mapped to game model.

part.line: Deciding appropriate dress for personality characteristics...

The computer confirms. It accepts commands and posts the results through the terminal. Effortlessly. It knows French?
